title: Hammer
description: Pistol, inflicts devastating damage on its targets, at the cost of any kind of subtlety.
content: Based on their ubiquitous rivet guns, also known as 'energy hammers', the 'Hammer' was an attempt at developing a low cost personal defense weapon. Popular among those wanting a dependable high-powered pistol, its weight and complex operation make it unattractive to the mass market.

title: Shattergun
description: An unconventional shotgun shooting crystal fragments through kinetic and thermal energy.
content: Crafted on Prospect station using salvage and wood from the planet itself, this scattergun demonstrates The ICA's ingenuity and ability to thrive with limited resources. A molded adrentite crystal, byproduct of its refinement for use as rocket fuel, serves as both projectile and propellant; a small electric charge incites a rearrangement in the crystal's lattice, with the sudden energy release fracturing the crystal into thin shards along its length as they're shot through the barrel.

title: Advocate
description: A dependable assault rifle offering a good balance between accuracy and rate of fire.
content: Based on the SAR-62 carbine used by the Federation itself, the ICA 'Advocate' has only a few deviations from the original design, meant to allow for its manufacture in environments of relative scarcity.

title: S-576 PDW
description: A commonly used SMG with high rate of fire which makes it formidable up close.
content: The CoTEC S-576 is one of the standard firearms used aboard Federation ships, stations, and outposts. Lightweight, compact, and produced in mass by various manufacturers, this model is a staple in practically every weapons market. This model doesn't look quite right, but it still gets the job done.

title: Kinetic Arbiter
description: A gauss sniper rifle firing metal rods at immense velocity. This weapon is favored among Prospectors that want to resolve their differences quickly and from a safe distance.
content: One of The ICA's most advanced conventional weapons, the Kinetic Arbiter is little more than a military-grade gauss gun stripped down to its most basic components needed to function, without any of the the fancy fittings or safety mechanisms.

title: Bulldog
description: Shotgun that suffers from very limited range.
content: Simple and effective, compact firearms utilizing shotgun shells are popular on stations as close range problem solvers for their high damage as well as for mitigating the risk of overpenetration that more conventional pistols carry. The Bulldog is the ICA's prefered design, easy to build and maintain, and even easier to operate.

title: KOR-47
description: Heavy assault rifle. Lower firing rate than most competing weapons in its class but packs a punch.
content: The KOR Bullpup Automatic Rifle 2247, more commonly known as the KOR-47, is Korolev Heavy Industries' signature weapon and a mainstay of many national and private armed forces.

title: Rusty K-28
description: An old rusty semi-automatic pistol. Its glory days are over.

title: Rusty B9 Trenchgun
description: Rusty Pump-action shotgun, high-spread, short range. Just a bit damaged.

title: KARMA-1
description: While heavy and requiring a charge-up to fire, a direct hit from the KARMA-1 will cripple if not outright kill any target.
content: The Korolev Advanced Recursive Magnetic Artillery, first prototype, is a miniaturization of the sort of weaponry more commonly found on warships, offered exclusively to the Prospectors for early testing. While no longer powerful enough to take down a spacecraft, it's more than enough to handle the threats of Fortuna III.

title: KM-9 'Scrapper'
description: A rapid-firing shard SMG, a good choice for taking out targets at close range, though of little use in long range engagements.
content: Faced with an ever-increasing surplus of adrentite sludge, an inventive Korolev waste management engineer brought forth a novel way of handling the hazardous byproduct: shoot it. The 'Scrapper' was the first viable weapon produced by Korolev Munitions, one of the megacorp's many competing arms manufacturing branches, and the first known to use adrentite crystals as ammunition.

title: C-32 Bolt Action
description: Bolt action sniper rifle that was commonly used by the local population.

title: Lacerator
description: A capable marksman rifle boasting a decent fire rate, accuracy, and handling.
content: Building upon the the ICA's own Shattergun, this battle rifle is tuned to discharge the crystaline shards it uses as ammunition in a more controlled and accurate burst.

title: Voltaic Brute
description: An SMG offering high versatility in its effective range.
content: Using parts built on Prospect station with material from the surface combined with salvaged components from power tools meant to build starships, the ICA's "Brute" more than lives up to its name.

title: PKR Maelstrom
description: A semi-automatic shotgun, it's heavy and a poor choice at range, but utterly devastating up close.
content: Korolev's first attempt at a building a phase weapon, the Phase-Kinetic Reactive "Maelstrom's" ammo pack carries more than enough energy to fulminate whatever gets in its way in a matter of seconds, provided it's close enough.

title: B9 Trenchgun
description: Pump-action shotgun, high-spread, short range. Yep, it's a shotgun, all right.

title: Basilisk
description: A phase tech marksman rifle; considered ahead of its time the impacts are powerful in its class, and also boasts a high rate of fire.
content: The result of an offshoot project during early development of the Phasic Lancer, the Basilisk trades higher ammo count for a much stronger energy discharge. While still in the prototyping, Osiris is happy to offer this rifle to Prospectors of a high enough standing.

title: K-28
description: A standard semi-automatic pistol. It's an effective sidearm for any Prospector.

title: Binocular
description: Used to look at things at a distance

title: Rusty S-576 PDW
description: A rusty used SMG with high rate of fire that still has some worth in close range engagements.

title: Rusty AR-55 Autorifle
description: A rusty automatic rifle, doesn't seem to excel anymore.

title: Scarab
description: A dependable pistol, fires controlled and powerful three-shot bursts.
content: The Scarab, an Adaptive Phase Pistol, is one of Osiris' most successful weapons, able to induce a localized rapid matter state change on remote targets at a fraction of the energy cost of more conventional laser-based weaponry. With energy efficiency and safety in mind, the Scarab is a solid choice of sidearm, though its compact form limits the extent of its lethality.

title: Phasic Lancer
description: A burst rifle shooting accurate controlled 3-shot bursts, effective against most threats a Prospector might encounter.
content: After the success of the Adaptive Phase Pistol, Osiris thought to develop a weapon platform of more interest to the military market. While this new powered-up weapon can handle significantly more energy than its smaller cousin, Osiris has yet to solve the problem of overheating in full-auto firing mode, or the high risk of carrier-shield leakage when in charged mode.

title: Manticore
description: A flechette assault rifle, it's heavy hitting but less accurate compared to other rifles.
content: Intended for use in pressurised environments, the Manticore was designed for more militaristic use than the compact ASP. Lightweight, accurate, and lethal, it's seen use by marines both performing as and defending against boarding parties.

title: ICA Guarantee
description: A fast firing Phase LMG perfect to suppress targets.
content: This Fortuna III custom isn't known for its finesse, but it'll chew through any target if the user manages keep it under control. With the amount of ammo expended, you're Guaranteed to hit something!

title: Gorgon
description: A powerful beam rifle that requires charging up before firing. Not the easiest to handle, but lethal in proper hands.
content: The Zeus' little sister, the Gorgon may not be as devastating, but its glare can leave any target petrified in place. And crispy.

title: Heavy Mining Tool
description: An experimental automatic Mining tool designed by Korolev to allow for more efficient extraction of Minerals from Fortuna III.

title: KOMRAD
description: This fearsome weapon platform is capable of firing salvos of fast-moving missiles capable of making short work of any hostile element.
content: Short for Korolev Ozone-powered Micro Rocket Assault Device, the KOMRAD is one of the most destructive weapon systems developed by the megacorp, and one of its most expensive.

title: KBR Longshot
description: A marksman rifle with good accuracy and power excels in medium range engagements.
content: The predecessor to the KOR-47, the Longshot was developed for the Federation to serve as a long range support weapon for ground troops. Designed with a low unit cost in mind, Korolev opted to ensure high accuracy and power over developing a fully automatic weapon.

title: Asp Flechette Gun
description: Lightweight SMG. A formidable automatic weapon for close range encounters.
content: Intended for use by law enforcement in pressurized environments, this weapons' flechettes provide lethal stopping power, can easily defeat light armor, and are designed to prevent overpenetration; a risk in any environment, but disastrous on ships and stations.

title: Zeus Beam
description: Called "Zeus" for turning any mortal into the God of Lightning, this heavy weapon will fulminate any creature that meets your divine ire.
content: While beam based weapons have found heavy use on warships for centuries, only in recent years has technology allowed for a portable form factor. These weapons use a linked-light beam to contain and focus a jet of plasma accross great distances, with a fairly predictable effect on whatever it contacts.

title: Flashlight
description: A portable hand-held electric light.

title: Mineral Scanner
description: A highly versatile scanning device that is only able to detect Nickel by default, but can be modded to detect any Minerals on Fortuna.

title: AR-55 Autorifle
description: A decent fully automatic rifle, doesn't excel in any one department, but comfortably versatile and lethally effective.
content: The AR-55 Phase Autorifle was commissioned by the IFA in an attempt to improve standard Authority armament without further increasing their reliance on Korolev Heavy Industries. While the IFA would eventually settle with the SAR-62, CoTEC's AR-55 remains a popular weapon in private armies and corporate security forces, and has succeeded at being an effective market counter to the popular KOR-47.

title: Audio Decoy
description: A small device that emits the sounds of fake gunfire to distract enemies.

title: Combat Stim
description: Offering an immediate 30 health boost.

title: Weak Stim
description: Offering an immediate 15 health boost.

title: Grenade
description: An thrown explosive device that detonates after a short delay.

title: Combat Medkit
description: Offering an immediate 100 health boost.

title: Strong Stim
description: Offering an immediate 25 health boost.

title: Strong Medkit
description: Offering an immediate 100 health boost.

title: Smoke Grenade
description: A non-lethal grenade that covers an area in thick smoke.

title: Gas Grenade
description: A grenade that covers an area in lethal poisonous gas.

title: Weak Medkit
description: Offering an immediate 100 health boost.

title: Large Backpack
description: A large backpack for storing items.

title: Small Backpack
description: A small backpack for storing items.

title: Heavy Duty Backpack
description: An extra large backpack for storing items.

title: Worn Emergency Bag
description: A worn out backpack that doesn't seem to hold much.

title: Medium Backpack
description: A medium backpack for storing items.

title: Epic Helmet
description: Protects the head of its wearer.

title: Common Tactical Helmet
description: Protects the wearer's head, and increases their stamina.

title: Uncommon Tactical Helmet
description: Protects the wearer's head, and increases their stamina.

title: Common Helmet
description: Protects the head of its wearer.

title: Rare Helmet
description: Protects the head of its wearer.

title: Rare Tactical Helmet
description: Protects the wearer's head, and increases their stamina.

title: Exotic Helmet
description: Protects the head of its wearer.

title: Rare Restoration Helmet
description: Advanced helmet that includes medical tech capable of reconstructing lost tissue over time.

title: Legendary NV Helmet
description: Enhances vision in dark areas. Can be turned on / off.

title: Uncommon Helmet
description: Protects the head of its wearer.

title: Uncommon Restoration Helmet
description: Advanced helmet that includes medical tech capable of reconstructing lost tissue over time.

title: Marauder Head
description:
The torn off head of a dead Marauder.

The eyes still follow you around. Creepy.

title: ICA Scrip
description: Rewarded by the ICA, required for upgrades to your Quarters' Supply Crate Generator and Gear Printer.

title: NiC Oil Cannister
description:
A pressured cannister filled with concentrated Nanite-infused Crude. It reacts to the storm radiation in strange ways.

Almost looks like it's alive, moving and swirling on its own.

title: "Magic-GROW" Fertilizer
description:
A powerful and sweet smelling chemical, can be processed to help manufacture other items.

Don't ingest within 6 hours of consuming any fruits or nuts. Or ideally ever.

title: Heavy Strider Flesh
description:
A chunk of flesh from a Heavy Strider.

Tougher than normal Strider meat, it barely bleeds.

title: Savage Marauder Flesh
description:
A chunk of Savage Marauder flesh.

Burns if you touch it without gloves.

title: Resin Gun
description:
Multi purpose tool, handy for sticking things together or providing flexible insulation.

The warning label says to not use if you need a warning label.

title: Smart Mesh
description:
Adaptable material, used for printing various items.

Also a fun art tool!

title: Heavy Strider Head
description:
The torn off head of a dead Heavy Strider.

Far too ugly to mount on a wall.

title: Crusher Hide
description:
Taken off a skinned Crusher.

(read: hacked repeatedly until something fell off)

title: Mature Rattler Head
description:
The torn off head of a dead Mature Rattler.

These things do NOT age gracefully...

title: Crusher Flesh
description:
A chunk of Crusher flesh.

Even its meat is hard as bone.

title: Pure Focus Crystal
description: Growths of these crystals are common on Fortuna III, valuable on the station for where they're often used in the creation of miniature figures.

title: "Fusion Cartridge" Batteries
description:
A pack of high-powered, slightly radioactive batteries. Safe to use in most electronic devices.

Not actually fusion powered, but still worryingly radioactive.

title: Salvaged Insulation
description:
Even outside of its intended purpose, the materials still have various uses in item printing.

Yes, it's asbestos.

title: Rattler Skin
description:
Taken off a skinned Rattler.

Fashionable! Just don't think about where it came from.

title: Autoloader
description: Used for printing a variety of equipment requiring regular charges, such as weapons.

title: Spinal Base
description: Wanted for several rare materials easily harvested from the spine, as well as for research by those looking into the origins of Fortuna III's hostile creatures.

title: Mature Rattler Eyes
description:
The eyes of a dead Mature Rattler

Age only improved the thing's sight...

title: Portable Lab
description:
A full lab in a box, also contains all sorts of specialized equipment and materials that can be repurposed.

Loaded with delicate tools, sensitive software, and no manual.

title: Shard Slicer
description: A delicate yet powerful machine used for printing certain items.

title: Copper Wire
description: Still the best bang for the buck for electric cables, makes for a good and cheap electric conductor.

title: Hardened Metals
description: Material used in a variety of printing and upgrading processes.

title: Interactive Screen
description: Interactive Screens were common among civilians on Fortuna III, used for all sorts of purposes. Cached data and basic components give them some selling value.

title: Meteor Core
description: Rare radioactive crystal, retrieved from debris of Fortuna III's cracked moon. Extremely valuable.

title: Electronic Cables
description:
A bundle of cables, still in good condition.

Unfortunately not platinum plated, unsuitable for true audio transmission.

title: Shock Absorber
description: A component used for certain weapons with heavy recoil.

title: Meteor Fragment
description: Rare radioactive crystal, retrieved from debris of Fortuna III's cracked moon. Highly valuable.

title: Titan Ore
description: Somewhat common on H-C5 planets, Titan Ore was essential during the initial colonization. Still used in a variety of printing and upgrading processes.

title: Clear Veltecite
description: A rare shard of clear Veltecite. Korolev will pay a decent bit of pocket money for any that prospectors uncover with their pickaxes.

title: Crusher Head
description:
The torn off head of a dead Crusher.

It's even uglier up close... Still, a fine trophy!

title: Miniature Reactor
description:
Useful for printing equipment with high power requirements.
DO NOT DISASSEMBLE. DO NOT ATTEMPT TO REPAIR. IF DAMAGED, DISPOSE OF AS INSTRUCTED IN FIG-24B.

title: Hydraulic Piston
description: Useful for printing weapons and beacons. The tech may be hundreds of years old, but if it works, it works.

title: Blue Runner Egg
description: Blue Runner eggs have a notoriously thick shell, allowing them to only care for the eggs when close to hatching. Can be sold on the station.

title: Circuit Board
description:
An old circuit board, its components can be salvaged and repurposed to build new items.

And now you can put e-waste management on your resume.

title: Marauder Flesh
description:
A chunk of Marauder flesh.

It moves if you poke it.

title: Strider Head
description:
The torn off head of a dead Strider.

Careful, it can still bite!

title: Korolev Scrip
description: Rewarded by Korolev, required for upgrades to your Quarters' Stash and Safe Pockets.

title: Nutritional Bar
description: Nutrion's flagship product, a full day's meal in a single candy bar.

title: Dustbloom
description: This lonely weed grows in open, arid areas on Fortuna III and develops valuable vibrant blossoms when exposed to direct sunlight.

title: Letium Clot
description: Solidified mass of Letium, rare and valuable.

title: Radio Equipment
description: An old colonial radio transceiver; salvaging these for item printing is cheaper than buying new parts.

title: Polymetallic Prefabricate
description: One of those "miracle materials", sheets of this stuff is commonly used in the printing of various tools, machinery, and of course, weapons.

title: Biological Sampler
description:
A portable device used for collecting biological samples in the field. Can be used to assist with printing delicate items.

This model incorporates a pressure-activated injector as well. Mildly concerning.

title: Old Medicine
description:
Medicine left behind on the planet, can be processed to make new supplies.

Fortuna's colonists definitely had a lot of pills...

title: Print Resin
description: Can be loaded into most printers to print the base components of almost anything, from rubber ducks to weapon parts.

title: Zero Systems CPU
description: Made for crunching through large datasets, used in several devices that require large amounts of simple calculations.

title: Master Unit CPU
description: An advanced CPU, ideal for the running adaptive AI systems or the manipulation of complex energy fields.

title: Ball Bearings
description: A simple mechanical component used to print a multitude of machines with moving parts, such as firearms.

title: Altered Nickel
description: Found in various mineral veins pushed to the surface by the same process that spawns veltecite, this ore seems to have been affected by proximity with the rare crystals.

title: Veltecite Heart
description: The "heart" of a veltecite vein, from which pure and common veltecite grows out of like roots reaching upwards to the surface. Incredibly rare and highly coveted.

title: Toxic Glands
description: The foul smelling sack some creatures use to produce compounds capable of breaking down common synthetic materials, nevermind human flesh.

title: Brittle Titan Ore
description: Somewhat common on H-C5 planets, Titan Ore was essential during the initial colonization. Still used in a variety of printing and upgrading processes.

title: Nickel
description: Found in various mineral veins pushed to the surface by the same process that spawns veltecite, this material is still worth mining.

title: Pure Veltecite
description: Very rare shard of pure Veltecite torn out of a mineral vein, highly valued by Korolev and others.

title: Aluminum scrap
description: Mostly aluminum and steel; not the most valuable salvage, but useful for printing.

title: Alpha Crusher Skull
description: It doesn't seem to have any real practical purpose, but this trophy is one of the most desired items Fortuna III produces.

title: Sample Container
description:
A sealed self-powered container for exotic alien samples.

Scientists are always putting little things in jars and hoping for the best.

title: Medical Supplies
description:
A small crate of miscellaneous medical supplies, has all sorts of chemicals useful for printing new items.

There are A LOT of warning labels here.

title: Charged Spinal Base
description: The base of the spine of a hostile Fortuna III creature affected by the Cycle. Contains some useful materials for various items or research.

title: Rattler Head
description:
The torn off head of a dead Rattler.

Corrosive drool everywhere, handle with gloves.

title: Optic Glass
description: Perfectly polished, lenses like these often find themselves used more in high-powered cutting machinery than in actual optic equipment.

title: Metallic Alloys
description: A collection of metal alloys used as a base material in many items, ready to slot into compatible printers.

title: Old Currency
description: Currency used on Fortuna III before the evacuations. Still in use by some on Prospect Station.

title: Brightcap Mushroom
description: Good for selling and desired by Osiris for their rare properties. Also tastes good, if prepared properly.

title: Jewellery
description:
A simple and easy way to carry one's riches and memories.

Also very easy to lose during an emergency evacuation.

title: Osiris Scrip
description: Rewarded by Osiris, required for upgrades to your Quarters' K-Mark and Aurum generators.

title: Pale Ivy Blossom
description: The blossom of Pale Ivy, a strange plant that likes to climb up walls to keep its gorgeous, divinely smelling petals out of the reach of critters and insects.

title: Waterweed Filament
description: The pollen filament of a Waterweed, a plant that can only be harvested around water bodies such as lakes or swamps on Fortuna III. The blossoms themselves are worthless, but these Filaments fetch a decent price on Prospect Station.

title: Focus Crystal
description: Growths of these crystals are common on Fortuna III, valuable on the station for where they're often used in the creation of miniature figures.

title: Textiles
description:
Heavy and durable fabrics, useful for printing various items.

You can never get the smell of mildew out of these.

title: Indigenous Fruit
description: Tastes delicious, and can be processed to gain some useful chemicals.

title: Rattler Eyes
description:
The eyes of a dead Rattler

Well, hopefully it was dead, anyway...

title: Alpha Crusher Heart
description: The heart of an Alpha Crusher, or at least chunks of it, can be used for several almost miraculous medical treatments. It's also a local delicacy, for those with more money than sense.
content: Alpha Crusher Heart

title: Flawed Veltecite
description: While relatively low in value, flawed veltecite is still valuable enough to be worth taking a pickaxe to some rocks.

title: Hardened Bone Plates
description: Dropped from some of Fortuna III's toughest creatures, can be used for printing certain items after refining.

title: Strider Flesh
description:
A chunk of Strider flesh. Presumably of a dead one.

You know, if you cook it properly it's actually pretty good.

title: Glowy Brightcap Mushroom
description: A rare glowy mushroom that can only be harvested during the storm on Fortuna. Highly coveted by Osiris.

title: Co-TEC MultiTool
description: Used to print, repair, and manipulate simple machinery and electronics. That includes weapons, of course.

title: Azure Tree Bark
description: Azure Trees are found sprinkled around the less shaded areas of Fortuna III, with their bark coveted for artisanal goods.

title: Compound Sheets
description: Standardized metal and plastic sheets like these are used to print everything from tractors to weapons, so long as you follow the right printing instructions.

title: Gyroscope
description: Helps keeps things pointing where they're supposed to be pointing even in the roughest conditions, making it quite useful for printing some weapon components.

title: Savage Marauder Head
description:
The torn off head of a dead Savage Marauder.

It's still blinking. Menacingly.

title: Magnetic Field Stabilizer
description: A component necessary for certain weapons with high power usage.

title: Derelict Explosives
description: Fortuna III's settlers took to using explosives to both mold the environment to their liking and get rid of the local pests. Can still be sold on the station, for fireworks of course.

title: Cloudy Veltecite
description: Shards of Cloudy Veltecite are often used for energy storage and generation. Korolev are always looking for any that prospectors can mine.

title: Ultralight Stock
description: Reduces the time to equip and aim down the sight.

title: Tactical Stock
description: Reduces the time to aim down the sight.

title: Light Converter
description: Projectile penetration increase.

title: 4x Optic
description: Optic with 4x Magnification.

title: MKM Ultralight Stock
description: Reduces the time to equip and aim down the sight.

title: Small Suppressor
description: Supresses the produced sound when firing.

title: Medium Creature Dmg
description: Increased damage towards creatures.

title: Titan Ore Scanning Module
description: Scanners equipped with this Attachment can highlight Titan Ore and Brittle Titan Orewhile scanning.

title: Standard Stock
description: Reduces the recoil when firing.

title: Ergonomic Grip
description: Improves a weapons time to equip.

title: Shotgun Slugs
description: Fires a single projectile improving the effective range.

title: Shotgun Quickdraw
description: Reduces the time to reload.

title: Tactical Foregrip
description: Reduces the time to aim down the sight.

title: Quickdraw Stock
description: Improves a weapons time to equip.

title: Heavy Quickdraw
description: Reduces the time to reload.

title: 8x Optic
description: Optic with 8x Magnification.

title: Medium Muzzle Brake
description: Reduces the recoil when firing.

title: Crude Oil Scanning Module
description: Scanners equipped with this Attachment can highlight active Crude Oil Wells while scanning.

title: Focus Crystal Scanning Module
description: Scanners equipped with this Attachment can highlight Focus Crystals and Pure Focus Crystals while scanning.

title: MKM Tactical Stock
description: Reduces the time to aim down the sight.

title: Holographic Sight
description: A non-magnifying Holographic sight.

title: Quickdraw Foregrip
description: Improves a weapons time to equip.

title: Light Extended Quickdraw
description: Capacity and reload speed increase.

title: Shotgun Extended
description: Increases the capacity of the magazine.

title: 2x Optic
description: Optic with 2x Magnification.

title: Veltecite Scanning Module
description: Scanners equipped with this Attachment can highlight Veltecite while scanning.

title: Small Muzzle Brake
description: Reduces the recoil when firing.

title: Medium Quickdraw
description: Reduces the time to reload.

title: Angled Foregrip
description: Reduces the recoil when firing.

title: Marksman Stock
description: Reduces the received kick from recoil.

title: Tactical Rear Grip
description: Reduces the time to aim down the sight.

title: Medium Suppressor
description: Supresses the produced sound when firing.

title: Shotgun Converter
description: Projectile penetration increase.

title: Medium Converter
description: Projectile penetration increase.

title: Light Quickdraw
description: Reduces the time to reload.

title: Medium Extended Quickdraw
description: Capacity and reload speed increase.

title: Light Creature Dmg
description: Increased damage towards creatures.

title: Heavy Converter
description: Projectile penetration increase.

title: Red Dot Sight
description: A non-magnifying red dot sight.

title: 6x Optic
description: Optic with 6x Magnification.

title: MKM Quickdraw Stock
description: Improves a weapons time to equip.

title: Medium Extended
description: Increases the capacity of the magazine.

title: Heavy Extended
description: Increases the capacity of the magazine.

title: Light Extended
description: Increases the capacity of the magazine.

title: Tactical Light
description: A mounted flashlight that can be toggled on and off.

title: 2 - 4x Variable Optic
description: Variable optic that allows to swap between 2x and 4x magnification.

title: Common Shield
description: Protects the body of its wearer.

title: Uncommon Shield
description: Protects the body of its wearer.

title: Rare Tactical Shield
description: Protects the body of its wearer, and increases their stamina.

title: Rare Shield
description: Protects the body of its wearer.

title: Common Tactical Shield
description: Protects the body of its wearer, and increases their stamina.

title: Epic Shield
description: Protects the body of its wearer.

title: Uncommon Tactical Shield
description: Protects the body of its wearer, and increases their stamina.

title: Uncommon Restoration Shield
description: Advanced protective shield that includes medical tech capable of reconstructing lost tissue over time.

title: Rare Restoration Shield
description: Advanced protective shield that includes medical tech capable of reconstructing lost tissue over time.

title: Exotic Shield
description: Protects the body of its wearer.

title: Janitors Key
description: A janitors key loop with a single simple key with a cute broom charm attached; it appears to longingly sweep at the floor as it dangles from your hand

title: Armory Key
description: The original label is almost unreadable but you can still identify the word "Jungle" at the top.

title: Loose House Key
description: Looks like the key to someone's house. The amount of rust and moss on it seems to imply its origin is somewhere deep in a jungle.

title: Lab Keycard
description: A bright white keycard with the telltale livery of Osiris. "Pinnacle Labs" is laser etched professionally onto it.

title: Bar Storage Key
description: A key to The Tipsy Drone attached to a miniature trinket of the namesakes affable drone mascot.

title: Bright Sands Observation Room Key
description: Keycard carrying the "Asclepius Vaccines" logo. And several biohazard warnings... may want to wash your hands.

title: Community Room
description: A key to a public space

title: Overseers Office
description: Labeled with "Nutrion Farms" and is emblazoned the Nutrion Farms logo. It's still covered in a sickly stale pumpkin juice... ew.

title: Tall House Key
description: A generic keycard, someone drew a house on stilts on the back.

title: Mine Access Key
description: Appears to be for one of the mine entrances along the northern edge of Bright Sands.

title: Boss' Office
description: The unmistakable "STARPORT" logo leaps out from the card. The smaller "Top Floor Admin" whispers for your attention in pitiful subscript underneath.

title: Garage Office
description: The keycard has an image of one of those rad looking 6-wheeler trucks printed on it with the text "Garage Office" alongside it.

title: Server Access Key
description: Labeled only as "Servers - Bright Sands", with the Com-Base logo.

title: Luggage Saferoom Key
description: The key looks like it is for somewhere in the Base Camp in Bright sands.

title: Skeleton Key
description: The original label is too worn out to read, but someone scratched "skeleton" onto it with a knife. Hopefully still works.

title: Letium Bio Samples
description: A container preserving... something. A label on the side states: "WARNING: HIGH LETIUM CONTENT, DO NOT SHAKE"

title: Uncommon Data Drive
description: A data drive with some interesting information. Data can be improved at an Uplink, or the drive exchanged for K-Marks.

title: Notes on Meteor Experiment - 1
description: Personal data tablet with theoretical research on powering energy generators with fragments from Fortuna's moon. The power output of a single working "Fireball generator would be revolutionary."

title: Letium Coated Helmet
description: An engineer's helmet caked in Letium. The embedded sensors may have recorded something important.

title: Miner Cam #D027
description: Owner named only as "Temporary". Last video shows several workers running out barricaded buildings and towards a clearing with a guarded ship being loaded with ore. Video cuts off after the owner appears to trip and fall.

title: Old Bones
description: Belonging to a long dead creature, damage has exposed metalic elements that seemed to have formed after death.

title: Data Drive
description: A data drive. Data can be improved at an Uplink, or the drive exchanged for K-Marks.

title: Notes on Meteor Experiment - 2
description:
Data on the first prototype for "Project Fireball". Yields under safe conditions were underwhelming, with warnings of an uncontrollable chain reaction if pushed too hard without further research. Might explain why there's a giant hole in the moon...

Final notes suggest switching resources to look into "NiC".

title: Oil Pump Part
description: One of the few remaining components from an old oil pump that still looks to be in working condition.

title: Warden Skull
description: The skull of a massive beast extinct before the colonization of Fortuna III. Parts of it seem to have unnatural grooves and geometric shapes.

title: Miner Cam #2F53
description: Camera belonging to a "Jamie Faulkner". The last video file is damaged, but the audio is of a large crowd demanding to be let in" before suddenly cutting off."

title: Orbital Cannon Beacon
description: Used for opening the Elite Crusher Caverns, highly charged Osiris laser gets fired at location of this beacon.

title: Rare Data Drive
description: A data drive with rare information. Data can be improved at an Uplink, or the drive exchanged for K-Marks.

title: Unique Data Drive
description: A data drive with highly valuable and unique information. Can be exchanged for K-Marks.

title: Miner Cam #A45D
description: Camera belonging to a "Mayumi S. Nagao". Video shows her being pushed out of a cargo ship by a Korolev Heavy Trooper and falling into the mud. Video cuts off shortly after an eruption of gunfire is heard around her.

title: Valuable Data Drive
description: A data drive with valuable information. Data can be improved at an Uplink, or the drive exchanged for K-Marks.

title: "Dig Site" Data Drive
description: A data drive carrying information on the Bright Sands Dig Site.

title: Flight Recorder
description: A cargo ship's flight recorder, only slightly damaged. Highly encrypted and beyond your suit's ability to access.

title: Laser Drill Control Unit
description: Part of the system that manages the Drill. Hopefully it can be reconfigured to safely mine for Letium.

title: Oil Pump Beacon
description: A powerful locator that can be used to call down an ICA NiC pump and refiner on an oil deposit.

title: Laser Drill Beacon
description: A powerful locator that can be used to call down a Korolev Laser Drill Platform on Extreme Letium Veins.

title: Alpha Crusher Bait
description: Printed using Mutated Biomass, this bait can be used to summon an Alpha Crusher at one of its Feeding Grounds.

title: Old Notebook
description: An Osiris researcher's notebook. It's seen better days. Full of formulas, drawings, and long paragraphs regarding the unnatural evolution and mutations of Fortuna III's fauna caused by Progenitor terraformers.

title: Sign of Life from Stranded Prospector
description: A photo of Marie and a prospector named Tao. Rare to see paper photographs anymore, it must have meant a lot to the owner.

title: Medium ammo
description: Ammo commonly used for assault rifles and light machine guns.

title: Special ammo
description: Ammo for explosive weaponry.

title: Light ammo
description: Ammo commonly used for pistols and submachine guns.

title: Shotgun ammo
description: Ammo for shotguns.

title: Heavy ammo
description: Ammo commonly used for sniper and designated marksman rifles.
